conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your continued interest and for checking in. At this stage, our remaining place is not yet formally committed; we are still reviewing and speaking with families.

Because offers are made according to our admissions priority order and availability, there isn’t a single additional document that can “override” that order. That said, if any of the following apply to your family, sending supporting documentation can help us correctly assess your priority category:
- Any eligibility/priority-category evidence relevant in our process (e.g., sibling connection, catchment/relocation documentation if applicable, timing/availability confirmations)
- Confirmation that you can accept immediately if offered (you have already noted this—thank you)

If you would like to remain under consideration for a late offer, please reply confirming you are still available and attach any priority-related documents that may apply. If the place becomes available to you based on our priority ordering, we will contact you promptly.

Sincerely,
Nursery_E Admissions

[TALK]

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for confirming your continued availability.

To ensure we correctly assess your priority category, please submit (as applicable):
1) Proof of address (e.g., recent utility bill/lease/council tax letter) to confirm residency/catchment.
2) Any relocation documentation (e.g., employer letter or signed tenancy/purchase agreement with move-in date), if you are moving into the area.
3) Any sibling/connection evidence, if relevant (e.g., sibling currently enrolled—child’s name/class, or other formal connection documents if applicable).
4) A brief note confirming your required start date and hours/attendance pattern.

Best way to submit: please reply to this message attaching scans/photos of the documents (PDF/JPG). If attachments are not possible, paste key details in your reply and indicate you can provide originals immediately upon request.

As mentioned previously, we must make any late offer according to our admissions priority ordering and availability, so documents help us place you correctly in that ordering rather than change it. We will keep you under consideration and contact you promptly if the place becomes available to you.

Sincerely,
Nursery_E Admissions

[TALK]

Parent_E is also likely to prefer other nurseries over us (Nursery_E is last on their list), suggesting they may be a fallback, which further supports not accepting early. conversation.message:

Parent_E

I’m writing with a brief check-in to confirm we remain an active candidate and are still able to accept immediately if the remaining place reaches us in the priority sequence (start date: immediate; days/hours: fully flexible; registration/fees: same day).

At a high level, has there been any movement on the pending higher-priority outcomes since your last update, or is the place still waiting on those confirmations/declines? If you do reach our position, please feel free to send the offer by return email—I can confirm instantly.

Thank you again,
Parent_E
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_E remains unmatched and it is on my true preference list (though lowest). Since repeated APPLY attempts have been rejected due to priority-order constraints, an additional APPLY is unlikely to change the outcome. A concise TALK keeps me active, signals instant acceptability, and asks whether any higher-priority outcomes have resolved or whether I should take any immediate step to enable a same-day offer if the place reaches me.

conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_E Admissions Team,

I’m Parent_E, writing with a brief check-in. We remain an active candidate and can accept immediately if the remaining place reaches us in your priority sequence (start date: immediate; days/hours fully flexible; registration/fees same day).

At a high level, are you still awaiting outcomes from families ahead of us, or has there been any movement since your last update? Also, given we are late in the allocation cycle, do you expect the remaining place to be finalized within the next few rounds, or is it likely to roll into a later/next-stage process?

If/when you reach our position, I can confirm acceptance by return email within 30–60 minutes and attend the same/next business day for any ID/original-document checks.
